issue.title: CTAD function_ref of data member pointer should produce noexcept signature

discussion.p: For data member pointer M C::* dmp, template argument deduction in form std::function_ref fr(std::nontype<dmp>, x) results in std::function_ref<M&()>, that returns a reference to designated member. As accessing a data member can never throw exception and function_ref support noexcept qualifed function types, the deduction guide should be updated to produce noexcept-qualified signature.
Set status to Tentatively Ready after six votes in favour during reflector poll.

blockquote.pre: template<class F> function_ref(nontype_t<f>, T&&) -> function_ref<see below>;

blockquote.p:
-6- Constraint:
(6.1) — F is of the form R(G::*)(A...) cv &opt noexcept(E) for type G, or
(6.2) — F is of the form M G::* for type G and object type M, in which case let R be invoke_result_t<F, T&>, A... be an empty pack, and E be false true, or
(6.3) — F is of the form R(*)(G, A...) noexcept(E) for type G.
-7- Remarks: The deduced type is function_ref<R(A...) noexcept(E)>.
